1.text: And the sabbath having intervened, Mary Magdalene, and Mary of James, and Salome, bought spices, that having come, they might anoint him.

2.text: And very early in the morning of one of the sabbaths, they came to the tomb, the sun having risen.

3.text: And they said to themselves, Who shall roll away for us the stone from the door of the tomb?

4.text: And having looked up, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.

5.text: And having come to the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right, being encompassed with a white robe; and they were terrified.

6.text: And he says to them, Be not terrified: Ye seek Jesus the Nazarene, being crucified: he was raised; he is not here: see the place where they laid him.

7.text: But retire ye; say to his disciples and to Peter that he goes before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said to you.

8.text: And having come forth quickly, they fled from the tomb; and terror and amazement held them: and they said nothing to any; for they were afraid.

9.text: And having risen early the first of the sabbath, he was manifested first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast seven demons.

10.text: She having gone announced to them having been with him, grieving and weeping.

11.text: And they having heard that he lives, and was seen by her, believed not.

12.text: And after these things, to two of them, walking about, was he manifested in another form, they going into the field.

13.text: And they having come announced to the rest: neither did they believe them.

14.text: Afterwards to those reclining at table was he manifested, and he reproached their unbelief and hard heart, because they believed not them having seen him raised.

15.text: And he said to them, Having gone into all the world proclaim the good news to all creation.

16.text: And he having believed and having been immersed shall be saved; but he not having believed shall be condemned.

17.text: And these signs shall follow those having believed; In my name they shall cast out demons; they shall speak with new tongues;

18.text: They shall take up serpents; and should they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall put hands upon the sick, and they shall be well.

19.text: Truly therefore the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into the heavens, and sat on the right hand of God.

20.text: And they, having gone forth, proclaimed every where, the Lord performing together, and confirming the word by signs following. Amen.
